ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to write anecdotal scientific journal entries, how children learn and develop through play
learned about the role of play in learning

I developed a fuller understanding of childhood development and how that relates to play and learning. This course was a broad overview to the field, with information on policy, language disorders, gendered play, and more. Perhaps more than anything, I gained a deeper appreciation for the developmental importance of play and exploration in a child's growth and learning.
Learned more about early childhood education and development

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I feel like doing individual child observations over the course of the semester due to COVID had its pros and cons, since we were unable to observe classrooms. I think one weaknesses of this was that there was no commonality of reference amongst the class when it came to observing child behavior (especially group behavior), since we had no opportunities to do so together in real time.

while each lecture/class was interesting, they all felt really disconnected from each other and so i didn't feel like the course had one cohesive thread. this was especially the case since so many of the classes were guest lecturers.

The instructors, Drs. Close and Horwitz, are incredibly friendly, fun, and thoughtful. The journal assignments are relevant and interesting. The guest speakers were all very interesting. In terms of improvement, finding a way to incorporate and build upon the readings during lectures and discussions would make the material more engaging. Additionally, being more clear about page requirements for the journals and general guidelines for the presentations would be very helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! You'll definitely learn a lot of useful information about child development through lectures and observations, and gain first-hand experience in seeing the developmental stages of childhood through first-hand experiences
Yes, this is a fantastic course to learn about the growth of children and the role of play in language and literacy development!

Yes! It is an interesting course on childhood development and education from two experts (and a number of guest lecturers) who have really unique perspectives. With that said, sometimes the readings and material feels a bit unengaging.

Yes! It was an overall very interesting and engaging class. The journals are a cool way to apply everything we learned in class to real life examples and gave me an opportunity to interact with kids during the semester which was a fun experience. If you like working with kids or are interesting in working with kids in the future, this class provides a great foundation for understanding early child development.
